qas.question: When was the Communist Manifesto first created?
The French Revolution resulted in the fall of which monarch?
When did the 19th century workers of Paris construct barricades and hoist red flags to protest their new government?
Who was tasked with stopping the late 19th century worker uprisings in France?
What did Karl Marx publish in 1884?
Who published the Communist Manifesto in 1884?

plausible_answers.text: built barricades and raised red flags

qas.question: What did Paris workers do in June 1488?

context: <a1_0><b6_0>Karl Marx<b6_0/><a1_0/> published the <b5_0>Communist Manifesto<b5_0/> in <a0_0>February 1848<a0_0/>, with little attention. However, a few days later the French Revolution of 1848 broke out, which replaced the monarchy of <a2_0>Louis Philippe<a2_0/> with the Second French Republic. In <a3_0>June 1848<a3_0/>, Paris workers, disenchanted with the new government, <b7_0>built barricades and raised red flags<b7_0/>. The new government called in <a4_0>the French Army<a4_0/> to put down the uprising, the first of many such confrontations between the army and the new worker's movements in Europe.
